body:
With a large list of charts, `helm chart list` will crash with the following message:

```
$ helm chart list --debug
Error: open
/home/me/.cache/helm/registry/cache/blobs/sha256/109971e44d63f7fd11fff60d19db41c2429a136943be2e3f8fd3e4c165156536:
too many open files
helm.go:75: [debug] open
/home/me/.cache/helm/registry/cache/blobs/sha256/109971e44d63f7fd11fff60d19db41c2429a136943be2e3f8fd3e4c165156536:
too many open files
```

I've found a solution in `internal/experimental/registry/cache.go`:
```go
func (cache *Cache) fetchBlob(desc *ocispec.Descriptor) ([]byte, error) {
    reader, err := cache.ociStore.ReaderAt(ctx(cache.out, cache.debug), *desc)
    defer reader.Close() // <------- added this and it fixed the issue
    if err != nil {
        return nil, err
    }
    bytes := make([]byte, desc.Size)
    _, err = reader.ReadAt(bytes, 0)
    if err != nil {
        return nil, err
    }
    return bytes, nil
}
```

I'll submit a PR in a few minutes.
